snippet: The White House is trying to play down the propaganda value for North Korea’s leaders and is readying a response, which could include suspending a food-aid agreement.
abstract: White House is trying to play down the propaganda value for North Korea's leaders and is readying a blunt response to its long-range missile launching, which will include the suspension of food aid agreement; United States also plans to rally worldwide condemnation of the launching, which now appears imminent.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JANE PERLEZ
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Jane Perlez from Hong Kong. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The White House is trying to play down the propaganda value for North Korea’s leaders and is readying a response, which could include suspending a food-aid agreement.

headline.seo: Few U.S. Options as North Korea Readies Missile Launching
headline.main: Few U.S. Options as North Korea Readies Missile Launching
headline.print_headline: Few Options as North Korea Nears Launching
